name: Get Security Events
description: Retrieves a list of security events of the specified type for the specified device for a specific time period.

type.description:
Type of security event. Specify one of these values:
	- 1 — Malware
	- 2 — PUPs (Potentially Unwanted Programs)
	- 3 — Blocked Programs
	- 4 — Exploits
	- 5 — Blocked by Advanced Security
	- 6 — Virus
	- 7 — Spyware
	- 8 — Hacking Tools and PUPs detected by Antivirus
	- 9 — Phishing
	- 10 — Suspicious
	- 11 — Dangerous Actions
	- 12 — Tracking Cookies
	- 13 — Malware URLs
	- 14 — Other security event by Antivirus
	- 15 — Intrusion Attempts
	- 16 — Blocked Connections
	- 17 — Blocked Devices
	- 18 — Indicators of Attack
Example: 13

period.description:
Period of time to retrieve security events for. Specify one of these values:
	- 1 - Previous 24 hours
	- 7 - Previous 7 days

hostname.description: Host name (base-64 encoded) of the device you want to retrieve security events for.

accessed_data.description: Indicates if data has been accessed.

action.description:
Indicates the action performed. For Indicators Of Attack:
- 0: Undefined
- 1: Informed
- 2: Attack Blocked.
For other detections:
- 0: Allowed
- 1: Moved Quarantine
- 2: Blocked
- 3: Killed
- 4: Ignored
- 5: Cleaned
- 6: Deleted
- 7: Restored
- 8: Allowed By Whitelist
- 9: Write Blocked
- 10: User Pending
- 11: Uninstalled
- 13: After Process Blocked
- 14: Immediately Blocked
- 15: Allowed By User
- 16: Detected Restart Pending
- 17: Allowed By Administrator
- 18: AllowedSonGwInstaller
- 21: Suspend Process
- 1009: Informed
- 1010: Unquarantine
- 1011: Rename
- 1012: Block URL

alias.description: Alias name for device control detections.

count.description: Number of occurrences in indicators of attack detections.

custom_group_folder_id.description: Identifier of the custom group folder assigned.

custom_group_folder_info.description: Hierarchical structure for the assigned group and its subgroups, in JSON format.

description.description: Name of device description in antivirus detections.

detected_by.description:
Protection or technology in antivirus detections.
- 1: On Demand Scan
- 2: File Resident
- 3: Mail Resident
- 4: Firewall
- 5: Device Control
- 6: Exchange Mailbox
- 7: Exchange Transport
- 8: Exchange Antispam
- 9: Web Protection
- 10: Exchange Content
- 11: Minerva
- 12: Web Access Control
- 13: Anti-theft
- 14: Anti-tampering
- 15: Personal Information Tracking
- 16: Isolation
- 17: Data Search Control
- 18: Patch Management
- 19: Personal Information Inventory
- 20: Application Control
- 21: Encryption USB
- 22: Authorized Software

detection_technology.description: Name of detection technology in exploit detections.

device_type.description:
Device type in antivirus and firewall detections.
- 0: Undefined
- 1: Workstation
- 2: Laptop
- 3: Server
- 4: Mobile

direction.description:
Direction of firewall blocked connections.
- 1: Incoming
- 2: Outgoing
- 3: Incoming and Outgoing
- 4: Internal

discard_motive.description:
Reason for discarding the knowledge sample.
- 0: Unknown
- 1: Other Reason
- 2: File Max Size

domain.description: Domain of device in antivirus detections.

endpoint_event_date.description: Endpoint event date in indicators of attack detections.

event_type.description:
Indicates the event type.
- 0: Malware
- 1: Exploit
- 2: Pups
- 3: Blocked item
- 6: Lock Plus Advanced Security
- 7: Lock Plus Application Control
- 8: Application Control

excluded.description: Indicates if the element has been excluded in antivirus detection.

file_info_discard.description: Hash to identify the file in antivirus detections.

filed_date.description: Filed date in indicators of attack detections.

instance_id.description: Identifier of instance for device control detections.

ip_address.description: IP address of the device in antivirus and firewall detections.

is_excluded.description: Indicates if data has been excluded.

like_lihood_of_being_malicious.description:
Indicates the likelihood of being malicious.
- 0: Low
- 1: Medium
- 2: High
- 3: Very High

local_endpoint.description:
Firewall blocked connections for a local endpoint, in JSON format: Mac Address, IP Address, Port, and IP Type.
- 0: Unknown
- 1: IpV4
- 2: IpV6

lock_plus_rule_id.description:
LockPlus Rule ID.
- 1: Obfuscated Params Powershell
- 2: User Executed Powershell
- 4: Unknown Scripts
- 5: Locally Built Programs
- 6: Documents With Macros
- 7: Windows Boot Registry
- 101: Forbidden Md5
- 102: Forbidden Program Name

made_external_connections.description: Indicates if malware made external connections.

malware_category.description:
Malware category in antivirus detections.
- 1: Virus
- 2: Spyware
- 3: HackingPpnd
- 4: Phishing
- 5: Suspicious
- 6: Blocked Operations
- 7: Tracking Cookies
- 8: Malware URL
- 9: Others

- 25: 1N
- 26: Behavioral

- 32: Not Confirmed Goodware
- 33: Unwanted Goodware
- 34: Ranked
- 35: Digital Signature

- 102: Worm
- 103: Trojan
- 104: TrojanPwdeal
- 105: Dialer
- 106: Joke
- 107: Security Risk
- 108: Spyware
- 109: Adware
- 110: WormFakefrom
- 111: Tracking Cookie
- 112: Pup
- 113: Hacking Tool
- 114: Vulnerability
- 115: Max Size
- 116: ZipOfDeath
- 117: PackerOfDeath
- 118: Hoax
- 119: Phis Fraud
- 120: Rootkit
- 121: Backdoor
- 122: Virus Constructor
- 123: Malicious URL
- 201: Advertising
- 202: Toolbar
- 203: NetTool
- 204: Advert Popup
- 219: Illegal
- 223: Internet Tools
- 227: Offensive
- 236: Society Education
- 241: Content Filter

network_activity_type.description:
Network activity type in firewall detections.
- 1: IcmpAttack
- 2: UdpPortScan
- 3: HeaderLengths
- 4: UdpFlood
- 5: TcpFlagsCheck
- 6: SmartWins
- 7: IpExplicitPath
- 8: LandAttack
- 9: SmartDns
- 10: IcmpFilterEchoRequest
- 11: OsDetection
- 12: SmartDhcp
- 13: SynFlood
- 14: SmartArp
- 15: TcpPortScan

number_of_occurrences.description: Number of occurrences in antivirus detections.

platform_id.description:
Platform of affected device.
- 0: Undefined
- 1: Windows
- 2: Linux
- 3: Mac
- 4: Android
- 5: IOS

protection_mode.description:
Indicates the protection mode.
- 0: Undefined
- 1: Audit
- 2: Hardening
- 3: Lock

protocol.description:
Protocol of firewall blocked connections.
- 1: Tcp
- 2: Udp
- 3: TcpUdp
- 4: Icmp
- 5: IP
- 6: All

reclassified_to_type.description:
Indicates the type to which it has been reclassified.
- 0: Blocked
- 1: Malware
- 3: Pup
- 6: Goodware
- 11: Removed From List

remote_endpoint.description:
Firewall blocked connections for a remote endpoint, in JSON format: Mac Address, IP Address, Port, and IP Type.
- 0: Unknown
- 1: IpV4
- 2: IpV6

risk.description: Indicates if it is a risk exploit.

rule_configuration_id.description: Identifier of rule configuration in firewall blocked connections.

rule_id.description: Identifier of rule in firewall blocked connections and in indicators of attack detections.

rule_mitre.description: Array with JSON pairs of the attack tactic and technique in indicators of attack detections.

rule_name.description: Rule name for firewall blocked connections and for indicators of attack detections.

rule_obsolete.description: Indicates if rule is obsolete in firewall blocked connections.

rule_risk.description:
Indicates the rule risk for indicators of attack detections.
- 0: Undefined
- 1: Critical
- 2: High
- 3: Medium
- 4: Low
- 1000: Unknown

security_event_date.description: Security event date and time for antivirus, firewall, and device control detections.

since_until_filed.description: Time since the filed date in indicators of attack detections.
since_until_filed.example: 8.07:06:05 specifies 8 days, 7 hours, 6 minutes, and 5 seconds.

site_name.description: Site name in antivirus and firewall detections.

status.description:
Indicates the status in indicators of attack detections.
- 0: Undefined
- 1: Pending
- 2: Filed

type.description:
Type of device for device control detections.
- 0: Undefined
- 1: Removable Storage
- 2: Image Capture
- 3: Optical Storage
- 4: Bluetooth
- 5: Modem
- 6: Mobile

was_run.description: Indicates if the item has been executed.
